text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- France awards Legion of Honour to Lebanese singer Fayrouz.
- If tensions grow among unionists, Interior Ministry will handle security on voting day in Beirut on Thursday.
- Constitutional Council to issue decisions by end of month on 19 appeals against results of last summer's parliamentary elections.

- Head of Israeli liaison unit in Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone says: "We will retaliate after operations." On Sunday Hizbollah guerrillas killed two pro-Israeli militiamen in bomb blasts inside occupation zone.
- Beirut Stock Exchange makes strong start to week; two of three listed bank stocks up.
- Extraordinary cabinet session scheduled for Tuesday.
- Industry in first quarter of 1997: exports at $48 million; 139 new factories.
